intro: Eremogone polaris, commonly known as the polar eremogone, is a rare flowering plant native to the Arctic tundra. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure and small, pale blue to white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in nutrient-poor, well-drained soils and is adapted to the extreme cold and short growing season of polar regions. Eremogone polaris plays a minor but ecologically significant role in Arctic plant communities.
